for (int i = 0; i < highScoreTable.Count; i++) gameManager.DrawText("fontsheet", highScoreTable.RowReturnAsString(i, " - "), 300, 200 + i * 40, new TextProperty(0.6f, 1, Color.Blue));

2000 - HB 1500 - ED 1000 - EZY

member.name: T:Engine7.LimitAction
member.summary: Actions to be taken once a Sprite meets or passes the limit box edge that is defined
member.remarks: The limit box can be any given rectangular or 3d box area or the current position of the ViewPort. Limit boxes are only active once a sprite fully enters them, if you are having trouble with a limit box make sure you make it visible using Limit.Show()

member.name: F:Engine7.LimitAction.nothing
member.summary: no boundary control

member.summary: make sprite bounce back in opposite direction
member.remarks: Nice for keeping a sprite within the boundaries of screen or rectangle. Such as in breakout/arkanoid type games

member.summary: Performs a bounce but only bothers checking the front and back of the limit box
member.remarks: Great when used in conjuction with Z gravity and auto sprite scaling to create a throbbing sprite

member.name: F:Engine7.LimitAction.bounceAlign
member.summary: make sprite bounce back in opposite direction but align with collided edge
member.remarks: Only use this if you want the sprite to start its bounce aligned to the edge of the limit box, you might get odd effects when doing this

member.name: F:Engine7.LimitAction.wrap
member.summary: make sprite appear on other side of limit box
member.remarks: Aligns the sprite with the opposite edge of limit box. Which can cause odd effects with groups of sprites following each other, use wrapExact instead.

member.name: F:Engine7.LimitAction.wrapExact
member.summary: makes sprite appear on other side of limit box taking account of exact position when leaving the limit box
member.remarks: use this for scrolling text or groups of sprites for an Asteroid wrapping effect

member.name: F:Engine7.LimitAction.wrapXBounceY
member.summary: only wrap in X direction, but bounce in Y direction
member.remarks: Use this if you want the sprite to wrap horizontally but fall under gravity

member.name: F:Engine7.LimitAction.wrapYBounceX
member.summary: only wrap in Y direction, but bounce in X direction
member.remarks: Use this if you want the sprite to wrap vertically but bounce off the sides

member.name: F:Engine7.LimitAction.stopAt
member.summary: make sprite stop moving in axis of limit box and align with collided edge
member.remarks: If a sprite hits the vertical edges of limit box then its horizontal velocity is stopped, it can still move vertically until it hits the top or bottom of the limit box

member.name: F:Engine7.LimitAction.stopFirstTouch
member.summary: make the sprite stop moving if any of borders are touched
member.remarks: Useful for title graphics where you want a sprite to stop in a specific horizontal or vertical position but dont want to worry about exact size of limit box required

member.name: F:Engine7.LimitAction.stopThenKill
member.summary: make sprite stop moving in axis of limit box and kill if no velocity set
member.remarks: Works like stop but if sprite has no velocity it will be killed

member.name: F:Engine7.LimitAction.killPast
member.summary: kill sprite once outside limit box

member.name: F:Engine7.LimitAction.killTouch

member.remarks: Greate for implementing electric fences etc...

member.name: M:Engine7.TileMap.LoadMapFromStringFile(System.String)
member.summary:
uses a string map file that contains the information on map size and tile map values size is determined automatically by the width of data and number of lines in map.
first string is a string containing the tile positions for the characters. eg if the first string contained "abcd" this would convert subsequent tile values from a to 0, b to 1, c to 2, and d to tile 3 any other character turned into a null tile -1
second string in file contains the width and height of the tiles in tilemap
example file start - lines starting with ; are ignored
;a - is border ;b - is a breakable wall character ;c - is player start position ;x - ignored so empty tile is placed at this location abcdefg ;tile width 16 and 20 high 16,20 aaaaaaa axxbxxa axxcxxa axxbxxa aaaaaaa
would create a tile map 5 rows and 7 columns, tile size 16 pixles wide and 20 pixels high with 7 different tiles a border of tile 0 with tile 1 in a line down the centre, null tiles everywhere else
member.param: filename containing the map
member.returns: true if read correctly

member.name: M:Engine7.TileMap.LoadMapFromDelimetedFile(System.String,System.Char)
member.summary:
uses a ascii comma separated map file that contains the information on map size and tile map values size is determined automatically by the width of data and number of lines in map.
first string is a string containing the tile positions for the characters. eg if the first string contained "abcd" this would convert subsequent tile values from a to 0, b to 1, c to 2, and d to tile 3 any other character turned into a null tile -1
second string in file contains the width and height of the tiles in tilemap
exmaple file start, using space as a delimeter
abcdefg 16,20 a a a a a a a a x x b x x a a x x b x x a a x x b x x a a a a a a a a
would create a tile map 5 rows and 7 columns, tile size 16 pixles wide and 20 pixels high with 7 different tiles a border of tile 0 with tile 1 in a line down the centre, null tiles everywhere else
member.param: filename containing the map
The character that separates each tile reference in the map

member.summary: Fills a portion of a tilemap where each tile is at least 1 by 1 pixel. The data for this comes from a texture using each pixels colour. For larger tile sizes (2x2) and (4x4) the sampling resolution is changed which gives Each pixels colour is converted into a packed value (unsigned integer) which is then converted into a signed int to be stored in the tilemap These are not intended to be drawn (and do not need adding to the tilemap manager), but rather used for pixel level collision detection. As Such the tilemap will be disabled. You need to make sure you have set the size of tilemap using SetSamplingMap() first. You should use this with special graphic maps using colour regions for different collision purposes.

member.name: M:Engine7.TileMapManager.FillMapFromPixelData(Engine7.TileMap,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Point,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.Texture2D,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Rectangle)
member.summary:
Fills a portion of a tilemap where each tile is at least 1 by 1 pixel. The data for this comes from a texture using each pixels colour. For larger tile sizes (2x2) and (4x4) the sampling resolution is changed which gives Each pixels colour is converted into a packed value (unsigned integer) which is then converted into a signed int to be stored in the tilemap These are not intended to be drawn (and do not need adding to the tilemap manager), but rather used for pixel level collision detection. As Such the tilemap will be disabled. You need to make sure you have set the size of tilemap using SetSamplingMap() first. You should use this with special graphic maps using colour regions for different collision purposes.
These colour maps can be used for a large variety of tasks, collision detection, height maps for scaling etc...

will be called at the end of EventOnce(),
will be called each time EventContinuous() triggers,
will be called at the end of ShowAfter() before sprite is shown,
will be called when sprite appears during ShowAfterFlashContinuous(),
will be called when sprite appears during ShowAfterKillAfter(),
will be called when Impulse stops for ImpulseStopAfter(),
will be called when flashing starts for StartAfterFlashContinuous(),
will be called when flashing starts for StartAfterStopAfter() and when flashing stops,

will be called when flashing stops for FlashStopAfter(),
